comments: If k is any member of A045572, the sequence lists the numbers n such that (n^k+1)/11 is a nonnegative integer. See also A267541. [_Bruno Berselli_, Jan 16 2016]
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 989
mathematica: f[n_] := FromDigits[IntegerDigits[n^2 + 2n - 1, n + 1]]; Array[f, 54] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 14 2009 *)Range[10, 1000, 11] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, May 29 2011 *)
prog: (Sage) [i+10 for i in range(475) if gcd(i,11) == 11] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 21 2009(MAGMA) [11*n+10: n in [0..60]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 18 2011
